private_information: I know the available actions and their informal preconditions and effects: paltry needs hand object_0 cats object_1 texture object_2 vase object_0 object_1 and next object_1 object_2. Paltry makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false.
sip requires hand object_0 cats object_1 texture object_2 next object_0 object_2 and next object_1 object_2. Sip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false.
clip requires hand object_0 sneeze object_1 texture object_2 next object_1 object_2 and next object_0 object_2. Clip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false.

wretched requires sneeze object_0 texture object_1 texture object_2 stupendous object_3 next object_0 object_1 collect object_1 object_3 and collect object_2 object_3. Wretched makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false.
memory requires cats object_0 spring object_1 spring object_2 and next object_0 object_1. Memory makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false.

tightfisted requires hand object_0 sneeze object_1 texture object_2 next object_1 object_2 and vase object_0 object_1. Tightfisted makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false.

I also have an initial statement describing a first world state and a proposed plan. The initial facts include cats object_0 collect object_5 object_1 collect object_6 object_1 collect object_7 object_2 collect object_8 object_2 hand object_10 hand object_9 next object_0 object_5 next object_10 object_5 next object_3 object_5 next object_4 object_8 next object_9 object_5 sneeze object_3 sneeze object_4 spring object_5 spring object_7 stupendous object_1 stupendous object_2 texture object_5 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8.
My goal in that scenario is next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6.

My proposed plan is clip object_9 object_3 object_5 then clip object_10 object_3 object_5 then wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1 then tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6 then tightfisted object_10 object_3 object_6.
player1.goal: Analyze the first scenario, validate applicability of the proposed plan, and produce a structured symbolic analysis of preconditions and effects for each step without producing PDDL.

private_information: I know the same available actions and their informal preconditions and effects described by player1.

I have a second world state and a second proposed plan. The initial facts include cats object_0 cats object_1 collect object_6 object_2 collect object_7 object_2 collect object_8 object_3 collect object_9 object_3 hand object_10 hand object_11 next object_0 object_8 next object_1 object_6 next object_10 object_6 next object_11 object_9 next object_4 object_6 next object_5 object_8 sneeze object_4 sneeze object_5 spring object_6 spring object_8 stupendous object_2 stupendous object_3 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8 texture object_9.
My goal in that scenario is next object_10 object_7 and next object_11 object_8.
The second PLAN block is empty in the specification so I may need to propose or validate a plan.
player2.goal: Analyze the second scenario, propose or validate a plan to achieve the stated goals, and produce a structured symbolic analysis without producing PDDL.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency for multi-step symbolic plans.

My responsibilities are to detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts and shorthand conventions, to convert quota tokens or post-hoc penalties into explicit predicates, and to produce a corrected consistent naming scheme and complete causal chain.
I must identify implicit assumptions such as unnamed intermediary objects or implicit effects and make them explicit.
auditor.goal: Audit the analyses from other agents to produce a temporally and causally consistent specification, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and emit an explicit declarative report describing corrections and canonicalized predicate names. Do not produce PDDL.

private_information: I coordinate integration of analyses and produce the final canonical PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner.
I must keep actions and agent contributions distinct and resolve naming mismatches or ambiguities originating from other agents and the auditor.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the analyses and the auditor report and output a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. The domain and problem must be enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively.

public_information: There are six action schemas in the domain: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted.
Predicates used include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring. Predicates take object arguments as described in private information.

Informal action summaries are provided but may use shorthand. For example vase object_0 object_1 expresses a relation between two objects. next object_A object_B denotes an ordering relation between two objects.
Actions may add or delete next relations and toggle vase facts. Some actions require multiple texture or sneeze facts that may refer to distinct objects.
Plans should be evaluated for precondition satisfaction at each step, and for side effects that may enable or disable later actions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst agent. Inspect the provided action schemas, the initial statement, and the proposed plan. Produce a structured symbolic analysis listing the facts true in the initial state, the preconditions and effects you match for each planned step, whether each step is applicable, and what facts are produced or deleted at each step. Identify any missing information or name mismatches. Do not emit PDDL. Keep all reasoning explicit and non-ambiguous.
analyze.prompt: Agent player1 context. Use the environment public information and your private information to analyze the first scenario goal and plan. Output a structured analysis that lists initial facts, planned actions in order, required preconditions per action, satisfied preconditions, predicted effects, and a final reachable facts set if the plan is applied. Mark any assumptions you would need to apply the plan.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst agent. Inspect the provided action schemas, the initial statement, and the (possibly empty) proposed plan. Produce a structured symbolic analysis listing the facts true in the initial state, optional candidate plans to reach the goal, preconditions and effects that matter, and any ambiguities or missing elements. Do not emit PDDL. Keep all reasoning explicit and non-ambiguous.
analyze.prompt: Agent player2 context. Use the environment public information and your private information to analyze the second scenario goal. If no explicit plan is provided, suggest candidate actions and justify their sequence with preconditions and effects. Output a structured symbolic analysis and identify assumptions.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency. Receive the structured analyses from other agents. Your task is to remove bookkeeping shortcuts and shorthand, convert any implicit tokens into explicit predicates or helper actions, canonicalize predicate and object naming, and produce a corrected symbolic specification and a report of changes. Highlight places where proposed plans rely on shorthand or post-hoc adjustments and provide explicit alternatives. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor context. Use the analyses provided to produce an audit report that lists renamings, expanded predicates, eliminated bookkeeping shortcuts, and any modifications required to make the plans temporally and causally explicit. Produce a canonical list of initial facts, canonical action preconditions, canonical action effects, and a short justification for each change.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for producing a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the analyses and the auditor report, resolve naming inconsistencies, ensure actions remain distinct, and produce STRIPS-compatible PDDL suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Include typing and :requirements lines appropriate for FastDownwards and avoid planner-specific extensions that FastDownwards does not support.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator context. Use the environment public information, the analysis outputs, and the auditor report to create a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the canonicalized predicates, objects, initial state, and goals for each scenario when applicable. Keep agent actions distinct if you model multi-agent effects. Provide comments in the PDDL only as plain parentheses comments. Output a domain and problem pair ready to be input to FastDownwards, enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively.
